newsitem.title: USA: Sun Media to sell $150 mln in junk bonds - sources.
newsitem.headline: Sun Media to sell $150 mln in junk bonds - sources.

text.p: Sun Media Inc, a Toronto-based newspaper publishing group, is planning to raise $150 million through an offering of junk bonds in the U.S., according to market sources.
CIBC Wood Gundy Securities Corp, the U.S. investment banking arm of the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce will be the lead manager of the 144a private placement, the sources said.
Proceeds from the offering will be used to refinance part of Sun Media's $250 million in outstanding bank debt, according to the sources.
Sun Media, formerly known as Toronto Sun Publishing Corp, was purchased in a management-led buyout in 1996 for C$411 million.
CIBC, which was part of the investor group, contributed $75 million in the buyout in exchange for a large equity stake in Sun Media.
Last week, the bank sold a 10.3 percent stake in Sun Media to a unit of Canadian telecommunications company, BCE Inc for an undisclosed price.
CIBC currently holds a 20.5 percent stake in the company, according to a Sun Media official.
Sun Media is the third largest newspaper publishing group in Canada, and owns publications such as The Toronto Sun and The Financial Post.
Sun Media chief financial officer Bruce Jackson could not be reached for comment.
The offering, which is expected to come to market sometime in February, will consist of 10-year senior subordinated notes, the market sources said.
